revised_title: The Role of Hyaluronic Acid in Regulating Proteoglycan Synthesis in Cartilage
tldr: This article investigates the effect of hyaluronic acid on proteoglycan synthesis and secretion by chondrocytes of adult cartilage. The authors found that hyaluronic acid reduces the incorporation of sulfate into macromolecular material, suggesting that it interacts with proteoglycans at the cell surface, affecting the secretion and synthesis of proteoglycans in cartilage.
